profile_positions.company: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen
profile_positions.description:
I am the Educational Support for the Creative Media & Game Technologies (CMGT). I am the Osiris and Blackboard support member for both the first year and main phase of the programme. I also assist in Osiris and Blackboard matters for the Game Design programme.

My main responsibilities are:
• Processing applications to the CMGT program
• Processing enrollments for courses
• Organising and creating class lists
• Internal communication with lecturers and study coordinators
• Communicating necessary information to students 
• Tracking study progress of students and reporting back to management and the study support team
• Tasks via Osiris and Blackboard to ensure lecturers can submit grades 
• Helping students with queries related to enrollment, admission, and general information
• Co-organising and doing communicated-related activities for Propaedeutic and graduation ceremonies
profile_positions.title: Educational support for Creative Media & Game Technologies

profile_positions.description:
During my time as the Webshop Coordinator for Hunkemoller, I gained experience working in a fast-paced environment with a wide range of responsibilities. I learned a lot about E-commerce which helped me to gain a new perspective on the bridge of sales and marketing, such as finding the balance between a data-driven approach and creativity. 

Day to day, my main responsibilities were:

• Maintaining 14 websites (both website and app) of Hunkemoller using Salesforce
• A daily morning check of all websites and bringing up any issues with the technical team 
• Changing the homepage daily based on performance data from Google Analytics
• Briefing banners and working with the design team for large campaigns and promotions
• Selecting images for the website based on performance
• Ensuring the menu/pages/category titles etc. are updated accordingly for each promotion
• Aligning with other teams (social media, marketing, merchandise, CRM and design) to ensure consistent communication 
• Updating and making sure content is up to date, for example, FAQs, delivery times, shipping prices. 
• Handling internal requests regarding website content 
• Creating campaign-specific content landing pages for Tiktok while keeping in mind guidelines, for example: https://www.hunkemoller.nl/tiktok/rebecca-mir
• Creating categories and product lister pages based on Merchandise requests 
• Requesting and implementing translated copy for the website(s)
profile_positions.title: Webshop Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
I chose to complete my graduation internship (and thesis) in the Marketing & Communications department at the Language Centre, University of Groningen.

During my time there, most of my efforts were focused on conducting research about how the Language Centre could best use social media to reach their aim to increase enrollments, as I'm very interested in the education sector and how marketing and communications can be used to achieve organisational goals.
 
This was done by looking at competitors and similar organisations, using theory and conducting interviews and surveys with the target group (students in the northern Netherlands). With the insights, I created a communication strategy for Instagram, implementation plan and provided templates for social media content. Additionally, I helped with odd tasks for the marketing department, such as creating YouTube thumbnails or altering descriptions.
profile_positions.title: Graduation internship in Marketing and Communications

profile_positions.description:
As part of my internship for Gemeente Groningen, I was an editor, writer and translator (NL - EN) for the Northern Times. 

https://northerntimes.nl/author/charlotte-hardy/
http://northerntimes.nl/
profile_positions.title: Contributor and editor

profile_positions.description:
I completed an internship at Gemeente Groningen in the Economic Affairs department, with most of my tasks revolving around the ''Make it in the North'' project, which aims to connect internationally-minded businesses with international students and graduates in the Northern Netherlands. 

My main responsibilities included:
• Creating and designing flyers, block schedules, posters and other printed materials 
• Organising meetings, taking minutes, sending agendas, preparing materials for meetings  
• Creating/maintaining playbooks for various career events 
• Researching, proposing and arranging workshops, keynotes, entertainment and catering for career events
• Organising marketing toolkits for the relevant target groups
• Writing articles and proofreading
• Proofreading vacancies for the Make it in the North platform 
• Creating a thorough social media (Instagram) plan and schedule for Make it in the North


I have specifically been involved in the following events:
• Make it in the North x Future Work (organisation)
• Student Career Event Emmen (organisation)
• Make it in the North x Sustainable Future (organisation)
• International Welcome day Friesland, IWCN (videographer, helping-hand)
profile_positions.title: Marketing and Communications Intern

profile_positions.description:
I volunteered for an event organisation workgroup for Make it in the North, a project focused on retaining international talent in the northern Netherlands (international students/graduates).

My main duties for the event were:
• Creating and maintaining the playbook for the event to keep a clear overview for involved members
• Organising workshops and keynote speakers
• Designing materials for internal use and for the event (block schedules, location maps, signs)
• Researching, proposing and ordering decorations with a budget in mind
• Assisting creating the agenda and action points for workgroup meetings
• Taking minutes of meetings and maintaining contact with workgroup members
profile_positions.title: Event volunteer workgroup
